content: The Act titled "Brownfields Economic Development Act of 2001" provides economic development grants. Section 108(q) of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to allow for brownfields redevelopment grants to eligible public entities and federally recognized Indian tribes on a competitive basis. The Secretary must allocate 10-30% of grants for brownfield site redevelopment in nonentitlement areas and by federally recognized Indian tribes. A brownfield site is defined as real property with potential hazardous substances.
